action.title: Action
action.description: Indicates desired action:  'deploy' means deploy the included declaration to targetHost; 'dry-run' does NOT deploy the declaration but does do everything short of changing targetHost's configuration; 'patch' modifies the declaration based on the provided set of commands and then deploys the updated declaration; 'redeploy' causes an old declaration from targetHost's declaration history to be re-deployed (property redeployAge (default 0) selects the old declaration, and note redeployUpdateMode as well); 'retrieve' returns a copy of a previously-deployed declaration; 'remove' deletes the declaration or declaration component.

redeployAge.title: Redeploy age
redeployAge.description: For action=redeploy (only), chooses which old declaration to deploy again.  Value 0 (default) means re-deploy the most recent declaration (the one which set the current configuration of targetHost-- useful to erase changes introduced by manual configuration).  Value 1 means re-deploy the declaration prior to the most-recent one, etc.  Note that whenever re-deploying an old declaration causes ADC configuration changes, that declaration becomes the current declaration (age 0) and the ages of all other declarations in the history increase (0 => 1, 1 => 2, u.s.w.)

redeployUpdateMode.title: Redeploy update mode
redeployUpdateMode.description: Value 'original' (default) means re-deploy the chosen declaration using its original updateMode (which if not explicitly specified in that declaration will default to 'selective').  Otherwise, forces the updateMode for re-deployment to 'complete' or 'selective' as specified.  Remember, 'selective' updates do not affect Tenants not explicitly named.  To simply roll-back the targetHost configuration to the state it had immediately after deploying some earlier declaration, put 'complete' here (that will remove Tenants created later than the redeployAge declaration).  To use action=redeploy as a simple roll-back facility, always deploy (updateMode=)complete declarations.

persist.title: Persist on device
persist.description: When true (default) make the whole working configuration persistent on targetHost after (and only if) this request deploys any changes.  If false, leave the working configuration in memory only (if targetHost restart, you may lose the configuration from memory)

syncToGroup.title: Sync to device group
syncToGroup.description: Name (like /Common/my_dg) of the config-sync group TO which the system should synchronize the targetHost configuration after (and only if) this request deploys any changes.  When empty (default) this request will not affect config-sync at all.  Leave undefined or empty whenever you use auto-sync or manage configuration synchronization separately

historyLimit.title: History limit
historyLimit.description: This value (default 4) limits the number of previously-deployed declarations saved on targetHost for review using GET and for use with POST action=redeploy and redeployAge=N.  The limit includes the current and immediately-previous declarations so may not be less than two

logLevel.title: Log level
logLevel.description: Controls level of detail in logs using RFC 5424 severity levels (default is 'warning').  Portions of declaration may use different logLevels

trace.title: Trace
trace.description: If true, AS3 creates a detailed trace of the configuration process for subsequent analysis (default false).  May be overridden on a per-Declaration and/or per-Tenant basis.  Warning:  trace files may contain sensitive configuration data

retrieveAge.title: Retrieve age
retrieveAge.description: Use this property with action=retrieve.  You can usually get a copy of the declaration most recently deployed to targetHost, and often copies of previously-deployed declarations are also available.  Value 0 (default) means 'the last-deployed declaration,' value 1 means 'the declaration previous to 0' and so-forth.  To get a list of available declarations, set value 'list'

targetHost.title: Target host
targetHost.description: Hostname or IP address of ADC to which request applies (default localhost)

targetPort.title: Target port
targetPort.description: TCP port number of management service on targetHost; default 0 means auto-discover

targetUsername.title: Target username
targetUsername.description: Username of principal authorized to modify configuration of targetHost (may not include the character ':').  NOTE:  this is generally not required to configure 'localhost' because client authentication and authorization precede invocation of AS3.  It is also not required for any targetHost if you populate targetTokens

targetPassphrase.title: Target passphrase
targetPassphrase.description: Passphrase for targetUsername account.  This is generally not required to configure 'localhost' and is not required when you populate targetTokens

targetTokens.title: Target tokens
targetTokens.description: One or more HTTP headers (each a property, like 'X-F5-Auth-Token': 'MF6APSRUYKTMSDBEOOEWLCNSO2') you want to send with queries to the targetHost management service as authentication/authorization tokens

targetTimeout.title: Target timeout
targetTimeout.description: Maximum delay allowed while communicating with targetHost device (seconds, default 150)

resourceTimeout.title: Resource timeout

defaultRouteDomain.title: Default route domain
defaultRouteDomain.description: Selects the default route domain for IP traffic to and from this Tenant's application resources (note: affects declared IP addresses which do not include a %RD route-domain specifier).  You must choose an existing route domain--this option cannot create one.  Route domain 0 (default) is always available

optimisticLockKey.title: Optimistic lock key
optimisticLockKey.description: When you deploy a declaration with a non-empty 'key' value here, that activates an optimistic lock on changes to this Tenant.  If the key in your declaration does not match the key AS3 computes for the most-recent previous declaration, then AS3 will NOT update this Tenant and will return an error code.  To use optimistic locking, first retrieve a declaration using option 'showHash=true' to get the current per-Tenant keys.  Make any changes you desire, then deploy your updated declaration.  Deployment of each Tenant with a key will succeed only if that Tenant has not been modified since the time you retrieved the declaration.  (To overwrite all previous changes to a Tenant simply do NOT include any opportunistic-lock key for that Tenant when you deploy a declaration.  That is the default.)  Note that only keys computed by AS3 may be used here-- you cannot generate your own. If 'showHash=true' is used on a POST then the optimisticLockKey will be shown as a part of the output (This helps to avoid the need to do a GET request).

responseCodes.title: Response Status Codes

methods.title: HTTP Methods

This option must be used to prevent small subgroup attacks, when the DH parameters were not generated using strong primes (for example. when using DSA-parameters). If strong primes were used, it is not strictly necessary to generate a new DH key during each handshake, but F5 Networks recommends it. sessionTimeoutMinutes.description: The number of minutes of user non-activity ot allow before the system considers the session to be over

Analytics_TCP_Profile.title: TCP Analytics Profile
Analytics_TCP_Profile.description: TCP Analytics profile with configurable options

collectedStatsInternalLogging.title: Collected Statistics Internal Logging
collectedStatsInternalLogging.description: Specifies that statistics logs are stored in the system

collectedStatsExternalLogging.title: Collected Statistics External Logging
collectedStatsExternalLogging.description: Specifies that statistics logs are stored on a remote server

collectedByClientSide.title: Collected By Client Side
collectedByClientSide.description: Specifies that system collects statistics on the client side

collectedByServerSide.title: Collected By Server Side
collectedByServerSide.description: Specifies that system collects statistics on the server side

collectRemoteHostIp.title: Collect Remote Host IP
collectRemoteHostIp.description: Specifies that the system collects IP addresses with which traffic was exchanged

collectRemoteHostSubnet.title: Collect Remote Host Subnet
collectRemoteHostSubnet.description: Specifies that the system saves the address of the subnet with which traffic was exchanged

collectNexthop.title: Collect Next Hop Ethernet Address
collectNexthop.description: Specifies that the system saves the address to which the traffic is being routed

collectContinent.title: Collect Continent
collectContinent.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the continent with which traffic was exchanged

collectCountry.title: Collect Country
collectCountry.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the country with which traffic was exchanged

collectRegion.title: Collect Region
collectRegion.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the region with which traffic was exchanged

collectCity.title: Collect City
collectCity.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the city with which traffic was exchanged

collectPostCode.title: Collect Post Code
collectPostCode.description: Specifies that the system saves the name of the postcode with which traffic was exchanged

port.description: Specifies a service for the data channel port used for this profile

ftpsMode.description: Specifies the policy for explicit FTPS negotiation on FTP command channel

enforceTlsSessionReuseEnabled.description: Enforce data connection to reuse TLS session

activeModeEnabled.description: Specifies if the profile should allow FTP active transfer mode

securityEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable or disable secure FTP traffic for the BIG-IP Application Security Manager

translateExtendedEnabled.description: Specifies if the profile should automatically translate RFC2428 extended requests EPSV and EPRT to PASV and PORT when communicating with IPv4servers

inheritParentProfileEnabled.description: Specifies if the FTP data channel should inherit the TCP profile used by the control channel

proxyType.title: Proxy type
proxyType.description: Default value 'reverse' is usually appropriate.  You may use 'transparent' when virtual server will handle a mix of HTTP and non-HTTP traffic.  You may use 'explicit' when clients will ask ADC to proxy connections to arbitrary remote services

encryptCookies.title: Encrypt cookies
encryptCookies.description: List cookies to encrypt en-route to the client and decrypt en-route to a pool member

cookiePassphrase.title: Cookie encryption passphrase
cookiePassphrase.description: Used to create secret key for cookie encryption (when missing, AS3 uses a system-generated key)

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

fallbackRedirect.title: Fallback Redirect
fallbackRedirect.description: Domain name (or IP address) of service (if any) to which AS3 should redirect a request when no pool member is responsive or selected pool member returns a fallbackStatusCode

fallbackStatusCodes.title: Fallback status codes
fallbackStatusCodes.description: When a pool member responds to a request with one of these HTTP status codes (for example, 500), redirect the client to the fallbackRedirect

requestChunking.title: Request chunking
requestChunking.description: Controls handling of HTTP payload chunking in requests from clients (default is 'preserve'). Note: 'selective' and 'preserve' will be translated to 'sustain' when TMOS version is 15.0 or newer

responseChunking.title: Response chunking
responseChunking.description: Controls handling of HTTP payload chunking in responses from pool members (default 'selective' adapts to most situations). Note: 'selective' and 'preserve' will be translated to 'sustain' when TMOS version is 15.0 or newer

rewriteRedirects.title: Rewrite redirects
rewriteRedirects.description: In selected Location-header values (default none) of redirect responses from pool members, change protocol HTTP to HTTPS before passing redirects to clients

multiplexTransformations.title: Multiplex transformations
multiplexTransformations.description: If true (default), AS3 adjusts request headers to work properly when the virtual server uses a Multiplex profile

insertHeader.title: Insert header
insertHeader.description: You may insert one header into each request before AS3 sends it to a pool member.  The header value may be a simple string or the result of an iRules TCL expression (for example, [IP::client_addr]).  This is the most efficient way to insert a single header; to insert multiple headers use an iRule or an Endpoint policy

name.title: Header name
name.description: Name of the HTTP header to insert

whiteOutHeader.title: White-out header
whiteOutHeader.description: You may name one request header you want whited-out of each request before AS3 sends it to a pool member.  To remove more than a single named header, use an iRule or an Endpoint policy.  (Whiting-out a header leaves its name but replaces its value in the request with space characters (ASCII 0x20) to avoid changing the length of the headers.)

allowedResponseHeaders.title: Allow response headers
allowedResponseHeaders.description: By default AS3 passes HTTP headers in responses from pool members to clients unaltered.  You may list names of allowed response headers here and AS3 removes any you do not list from responses.

xForwardedFor.title: Insert X-Forwarded-For
xForwardedFor.description: If true, insert an X-Forwarded-For header carrying the client IP address into each HTTP request sent to a pool member (default false)

trustXFF.title: Trust X-Forwarded-For
trustXFF.description: If true, WAF (ASM) and AVR may trust X-Forwarded-For headers found in incoming requests and report statistics using client IP addresses appearing in them (default false).  Use this feature only when you control upstream gateway(s)

otherXFF.title: Other XFF headers
otherXFF.description: Names of request headers to treat as equivalent to X-Forwarded-For (see trustXFF)

hstsInsert.title: Insert HSTS headers
hstsInsert.description: If true, insert HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) headers into responses sent to clients (default false).  Warning:  misconfiguration of HSTS can make a website unreachable

hstsPeriod.title: Period of HSTS
hstsPeriod.description: If hstsInsert is true, this value tells each client how long (in seconds; default 7862400 equals 91 days) to wait before refreshing HSTS settings for this service.  Warning:  once a client receives erroneous HSTS settings it will ignore any attempt to correct them until this period has expired

hstsIncludeSubdomains.title: Include subdomains in HSTS
hstsIncludeSubdomains.description: If true then HSTS headers (see hstsInsert) will tell clients to apply HSTS settings to the hostnames of this service and all their possible subdomains.  Warning: an incorrect value here can make multiple websites unreachable, not just this service

hstsPreload.title: Include domain in preload list
hstsPreload.description: If true, include the domain for the web site associated with this HTTP profile in the browser's preload list. This forces the client to send packets over SSL/TLS.

viaRequest.title: Via request control
viaRequest.description: Controls treatment of Via: headers in requests from clients.  When set to 'append' AS3 requires viaHost

viaResponse.title: Via response control
viaResponse.description: Controls treatment of Via: headers in responses from pool members.  When set to 'append' AS3 requires viaHost

viaHost.title: Via hostname
viaHost.description: Hostname to place in Via header when viaRequest or viaResponse is 'append'

serverHeaderValue.title: Server header value
serverHeaderValue.description: Server header value to place in responses generated by the ADC itself (not obtained from a pool member)

knownMethods.title: Known methods
knownMethods.description: List of HTTP request methods AS3 should recognize as normal.  Any method not in this list will provoke the 'unknownMethodAction' action

unknownMethodAction.title: Unknown method action
unknownMethodAction.description: Default 'allow' means clients may make HTTP requests using unknown methods.  Otherwise, 'reject' means to discard any unknown-method request and reject the client connection, and 'pass-through' causes the connection to switch to pass-through mode upon the first unknown-method request

maxRequests.title: Maximum requests per connection
maxRequests.description: When AS3 has processed more than this number of requests through a connection, the system closes it.  Default 0 means permit unlimited requests

pipelineAction.title: Pipeline action
pipelineAction.description: Default 'allow' means clients may pipeline HTTP/1.1 requests to pool members which support pipelining.  Otherwise, 'reject' prevents pipelining, and 'pass-through' causes the connection to switch to pass-through mode when the system detects pipelining

webSocketsEnabled.title: Web sockets
webSocketsEnabled.description: When true, allow clients to initiate Web Socket connections (default false)

webSocketMasking.title: Web socket masking
webSocketMasking.description: Web-socket stream data is always masked from client to ADC and from ADC to server.  Default value 'unmask' makes stream data passing through visible to ADC security policy and/or iRules attached to the service.  'selective' unmasks stream data only when a security policy is attached.  'preserve' passes data through masked (unreadable by security policy).  'remask' causes different masking keys to be used on client and server sides

HTTP_Profile_Reverse.title: HTTP Profile Reverse
HTTP_Profile_Reverse.description: Extra HTTP profile configurable options when proxyType is 'reverse'

maxHeaderCount.title: Maximum header count
maxHeaderCount.description: When the number of headers in an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum header size
maxHeaderSize.description: When the total size in octets of the headers of an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

truncatedRedirects.title: Truncated redirects
truncatedRedirects.description: If false (default) elide malformed redirects from pool members, otherwise pass them to client

HTTP_Profile_Transparent.title: HTTP Profile Transparent
HTTP_Profile_Transparent.description: Extra HTTP profile configurable options when proxyType is 'transparent'

maxHeaderCount.title: Maximum header count
maxHeaderCount.description: When the number of headers in a request or response exceeds this value (default 32), take the excessX...Headers action

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum header size
maxHeaderSize.description: When the total size in octets of the headers of request or response exceeds this value (default 16384), take the oversizeX...Headers action

excessClientHeaders.title: Excess client headers action
excessClientHeaders.description: When a client request violates maxHeaderCount, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

excessServerHeaders.title: Excess server headers action
excessServerHeaders.description: When a pool member response violates maxHeaderCount, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

oversizeClientHeaders.title: Oversize client headers action
oversizeClientHeaders.description: When a client request violates maxHeaderSize, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

oversizeServerHeaders.title: Oversize server headers action
oversizeServerHeaders.description: When a pool member response violates maxHeaderSize, either switch to pass-through mode (default) or reject the connection

truncatedRedirects.title: Truncated redirects
truncatedRedirects.description: If true (default) pass malformed redirects to client

HTTP_Profile_Explicit.title: HTTP Profile Explicit
HTTP_Profile_Explicit.description: Extra HTTP profile configurable options when proxyType is 'explicit'

maxHeaderCount.title: Maximum header count
maxHeaderCount.description: When the number of headers in an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

maxHeaderSize.title: Maximum header size
maxHeaderSize.description: When the total size in octets of the headers of an incoming HTTP request exceeds this value, discard the request and reset the client connection

truncatedRedirects.title: Truncated redirects
truncatedRedirects.description: If false (default) elide malformed redirects from pool members, otherwise pass them to client

resolver.title: DNS resolver
resolver.description: AS3 pointer to DNS resolver used to resolve hostnames in client requests

bigip.title: BIG-IP resolver
bigip.description: Pathname of existing BIG-IP net DNS resolver

doNotProxyHosts.title: Do-not-proxy hosts
doNotProxyHosts.description: When a client makes a (proxy-type) request to some host on this list, that request will simply be load-balanced to a pool member (without DNS resolution).  This is ineffective for HTTPS requests

tunnelName.title: Tunnel name
tunnelName.description: Name of tunnel used for outbound CONNECT requests (default 'http-tunnel')

defaultConnectAction.title: Default CONNECT action
defaultConnectAction.description: By default (value 'deny') the system refuses CONNECT requests from clients except when there is a virtual server listening to the tunnelName tunnel to accept and process them (typically to authorize and/or intercept outbound TLS connections).  Value 'allow' will let clients CONNECT to arbitrary remote services

routeDomain.title: Exit route domain
routeDomain.description: Proxy requests will leave the ADC from a Self IP in this route domain (default 0)

connectErrorMessage.title: Connect-error message
connectErrorMessage.description: Message returned to client when the system cannot establish a proxy connection.  May include iRules TCL expressions
connectErrorMessage.default: Unable to connect to host in proxy request

dnsErrorMessage.title: DNS-error message
dnsErrorMessage.description: Message returned to the client when the system cannot resolve the hostname in the request.  May include iRules TCL expressions
dnsErrorMessage.default: Cannot resolve hostname in proxy request

badRequestMessage.title: Bad-request message
badRequestMessage.description: Message returned to client when proxy request is erroneous.  May include iRules TCL expressions

badResponseMessage.title: Bad-response message
badResponseMessage.description: Message returned to client when response to proxy request is erroneous.  May include iRules TCL expressions

ipv6.title: IPv6 first priority
ipv6.description: Specifies the relative order of IPv4 and IPv6 DNS resolutions for URIs. If false (default), then the system performs IPv4 lookup before IPv6.

HTTP_Compress.title: HTTP Compression profile
HTTP_Compress.description: HTTP Compression profile with configurable options

allowHTTP10.title: Allow HTTP/1.0
allowHTTP10.description: If true, AS3 may compress HTTP/1.0 responses (default false)

bufferSize.title: Buffer size
bufferSize.description: Maximum number of response octets to buffer before deciding whether to apply compression (default 4096)

contentTypeExcludes.title: Content-Type exclude list
contentTypeExcludes.description: List of response Content-Type values which AS3 should not compress.  Values are regular expressions that match Content-Type strings

contentTypeIncludes.title: Content-Type include list
contentTypeIncludes.description: List of response Content-Type values which AS3 should compress.  Values are regular expressions that match Content-Type strings

uriExcludes.title: URI exclude list
uriExcludes.description: List of request URI's for which AS3 should not compress responses.  Values are regular expressions that match request URI strings

uriIncludes.title: URI include list
uriIncludes.description: List of request URI's for which AS3 should compress responses.  Values are regular expressions that match URI strings

cpuSaver.title: CPU saver
cpuSaver.description: If true (default), system will reduce compression rate when CPU utilization exceeds cpuSaverHigh threshold and increase it when CPU utilization falls below cpuSaverLow threshold

cpuSaverHigh.title: CPU-saver %high
cpuSaverHigh.description: CPU utilization percentage (default 90) above which AS3 should moderate compression

cpuSaverLow.title: CPU-saver %low
cpuSaverLow.description: CPU utilization percentage (default 75) below which the system returns compression to normal

minimumSize.title: Minimum size to compress
minimumSize.description: AS3 will not compress responses of fewer octets than this (default 1024)

preferMethod.title: Prefer method
preferMethod.description: Select preferred compression method (default gzip, strongly recommended)

gzipLevel.title: GZIP level
gzipLevel.description: Compression level (default 1); higher values produce greater compression but use more CPU cycles

gzipMemory.title: GZIP memory level
gzipMemory.description: Compression memory allocation in kilobytes (default 8), should be a power of two

gzipWindowSize.title: GZIP window size
gzipWindowSize.description: Compression window size in kilobytes (default 16), should be a power of two

keepAcceptEncoding.title: Keep Accept-Encoding header
keepAcceptEncoding.description: If true, pool member may compress responses; if false (default) ADC will compress responses.  Set to true when pool member stores/caches pre-compressed responses

selective.title: Selective mode
selective.description: If true, AS3 will only compress a response when an iRule attached to the virtual server requests it (default is false, meaning AS3 will compress responses which meet the criteria in this profile)

varyHeader.title: Vary header
varyHeader.description: If true (default), a Vary header will appear in compressed responses

activationMode.title: Activation Mode
activationMode.description: This setting specifies the condition that will cause the BIG-IP system to handle an incoming connection as an HTTP/2 connection.

concurrentStreamsPerConnection.title: Concurrent streams per connection
concurrentStreamsPerConnection.description: The number of concurrent connections to allow on a single HTTP/2 connection.

connectionIdleTimeout.title: Connection idle timeout
connectionIdleTimeout.description: The number of seconds that a HTTP/2 connection is left open idly before it is closed.

enforceTlsRequirements.title: Enforce TLS requirements
enforceTlsRequirements.description: Enable or disable enforcement of TLS requirements.

frameSize.title: Frame size
frameSize.description: The size of the data frames, in bytes, that the HTTP/2 protocol sends to the client.

headerTableSize.title: Header table size
headerTableSize.description: The size of the header table, in KB, for the HTTP headers that the HTTP/2 protocol compresses to save bandwidth.

includeContentLength.title: Include content length
includeContentLength.description: Enable to include content-length in HTTP/2 headers.

insertHeader.title: Insert header
insertHeader.description: This setting specifies whether the BIG-IP system should add an HTTP header to the HTTP request to show that the request was received over HTTP/2.

insertHeaderName.title: Insert header name
insertHeaderName.description: This setting specifies the name of the header that the BIG-IP system will add to the HTTP request when the Insert Header is enabled.

receiveWindow.title: Receive window
receiveWindow.description: The flow-control size for upload streams, in KB.

writeSize.title: Write size
writeSize.description: The total size of combined data frames, in bytes, that the HTTP/2 protocol sends in a single write function.

sourceMask.title: Source Address Mask
sourceMask.description: Idle connection re-use applies to connections whose source address matches this mask

maxConnections.title: Maximum Connections
maxConnections.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections that the system holds in the connection reuse pool.

maxConnectionAge.title: Maximum Connection Age
maxConnectionAge.description: Specifies the maximum age, in number of seconds, of a connection in the connection reuse pool.

maxConnectionReuse.title: Maximum Connection Reuse
maxConnectionReuse.description: Specifies the maximum number of times that a server connection can be reused.

idleTimeoutOverride.title: Idle Timeout Override
idleTimeoutOverride.description: Specifies the number of seconds that a connection is idle before the connection flow is eligible for deletion.

connectionLimitEnforcement.title: Connection Limit Enforcement
connectionLimitEnforcement.description: When the limit is 'none', simultaneous in-flight requests and responses over TCP connections to a pool member are counted toward the limit. When the limit is 'idle', idle connections will be dropped as the TCP connection limit is reached. When the limit is 'strict', idle connections will prevent new TCP connections from being made until they expire (not recommended).

sharePools.title: Share Pools
sharePools.description: Indicates that TCP connections for the current pool may be shared among similar virtual servers using the same pool.

TCP_Profile.title: TCP Profile
TCP_Profile.description: Configures a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) profile
TCP_Profile.$comment: Configures TCP settings. When deployed on BIG-IP, defaults match f5-tcp-progressive.

abc.title: Appropriate Byte Counting
abc.description: If true (default), AS3 adjusts the congestion window per rfc3465

ackOnPush.title: ACK on PSH
ackOnPush.description: If true (default), the system immediately acknowledges segments with the PSH flag set

autoProxyBufferSize.title: Automatic proxy-buffer size
autoProxyBufferSize.description: If true (default), AS3 adjusts the proxy buffer size automatically to optimize throughput

autoReceiveWindowSize.title: Automatic receive-window size
autoReceiveWindowSize.description: If true (default), AS3 adjusts the receive window size automatically to optimize throughput

autoSendBufferSize.title: Automatic send-buffer size
autoSendBufferSize.description: If true (default), AS3 adjusts the send buffer size automatically to optimize throughput

closeWaitTimeout.title: Close-wait timeout
closeWaitTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 5) connection will remain in LAST-ACK state before exiting.  Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

congestionControl.title: Congestion-control algorithm
congestionControl.description: Selects TCP congestion-control algorithm (default 'woodside'). Note: bbr is only supported in tmos version 14.1+.

congestionMetricsCache.title: Congestion metrics cache
congestionMetricsCache.description: If true (default), the system may cache congestion metrics to inform the congestion control algorithm

congestionMetricsCacheTimeout.title: Congestion metrics cache timeout
congestionMetricsCacheTimeout.description: Number of seconds for which entries in the congestion metrics cache are valid (default 0 means use system default)

deferredAccept.title: Deferred accept
deferredAccept.description: If true, ADC will defer allocating resources to a connection until some payload data has arrived from the client (default false).  This may help minimize the impact of certain DoS attacks but adds undesirable latency under normal conditions.  Note:  'deferredAccept' is incompatible with server-speaks-first application protocols

delayedAcks.title: Delayed ACKs
delayedAcks.description: If true (default), the system may coalesce multiple adjacent ACK responses

delayWindowControl.title: Delay-window control
delayWindowControl.description: If true, AS3 uses queueing delay as well as packet loss to estimate congestion (default false)

dsack.title: Use D-SACK
dsack.description: If true, AS3 uses rfc2883 duplicate selective-acknowledgements extension (default false).  Do not enable this option unless you are certain all peers support D-SACK

earlyRetransmit.title: Early retransmit
earlyRetransmit.description: If true (default), AS3 uses rfc5827 Early Retransmit recovery

ecn.title: Explicit congestion notification
ecn.description: If true (default), AS3 may send explicit congestion notification (ECN) flags (CWR, ECE) to peers

enhancedLossRecovery.title: Enhanced loss recovery
enhancedLossRecovery.description: If true (default), AS3 uses Selective ACK data to increase throughput

fastOpen.title: Fast-open
fastOpen.description: If true (default), the system can use the TCP Fast Open protocol extension to reduce latency by sending payload data with initial SYN

fastOpenCookieExpiration.title: Fast-open cookie expiration
fastOpenCookieExpiration.description: Sets maximum lifetime in seconds (default 21600 = six hours) of TCP Fast Open cookies

finWaitTimeout.title: FIN-WAIT timeout
finWaitTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 5) connection will remain in FIN-WAIT-1 or closing state before exiting.  Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

finWait2Timeout.title: FIN-WAIT-2 timeout
finWait2Timeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300) connection will remain in LAST-ACK state before closing.  Value -1 means indefinite, limited by maximum retransmission timeout

idleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300; may not be 0) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion.  Value -1 (not recommended) means infinite

initCwnd.title: Initial congestion-window size
initCwnd.description: Sets the initial congestion-window size (default 16) in multiples of MSS (not in octets)

initRwnd.title: Initial receive-window size
initRwnd.description: Sets the initial receive-window size (default 16) in multiples of MSS (not in octets)

ipDfMode.title: IP DF mode
ipDfMode.description: Controls DF (Don't Fragment) flag in outgoing packets.  Value 'pmtu' (default) sets DF based on IP PMTU value.  Value 'preserve' copies DF from received packets.  Value 'set' forces DF true in all outgoing packets.  Value 'clear' forces DF false in all outgoing packets

ipTosToClient.title: IP DSCP (TOS) to client
ipTosToClient.description: Specifies the IP DSCP/TOS value in packets sent to clients (default 0).  Numeric values in this property are decimal representations of eight-bit numbers, of which the leftmost six bits are the DSCP per rfc2474 (and the system uses the rightmost two bits for congestion signaling when 'ecn' is true).  You may have to calculate the value of this property by multiplying a DSCP code, such as CS5+EF = 46, by four to obtain the proper 'ipTosToClient' value, such as 184.  Value 'pass-through' sets DSCP from the initial server-side value.  Value 'mimic' copies DSCP from the most-recently received server-side packet (allowing DSCP to vary during the life of a connection)

keepAliveInterval.title: Keep-alive interval
keepAliveInterval.description: Number of seconds (default 1800) between keep-alive probes

limitedTransmit.title: Limited transmit recovery
limitedTransmit.description: When true (default), the system can use rfc3042 limited transmit recovery scheme

linkQosToClient.title: Link QOS to client
linkQosToClient.description: Specifies the Layer-2 QOS code in packets sent to clients (default 0).  Ethernet-type networks recognize codes from 0 to 7.  Value 'pass-through' sets QOS from the initial server-side value

maxRetrans.title: Maximum segment retransmissions
maxRetrans.description: Sets maximum number of times the system may retransmit a segment (default 8)

maxSegmentSize.title: MSS
maxSegmentSize.description: Sets MSS advertised to peer.  Value 0 (default) will set MSS automatically in proportion to interface MTU.  Default 0 is usually the best choice

md5Signature.title: MD5 signatures
md5Signature.description: If true, the system signs TCP headers using MD5 per rfc2385 (default false)

md5SignaturePassphrase.title: MD5 passphrase
md5SignaturePassphrase.description: Passphrase from which the system derives the key for MD5 signatures (MACs) when 'md5signature' is true

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

mptcp.title: Multipath TCP (MPTCP)
mptcp.description: Value 'disable' (default) excludes use of Multipath TCP (MPTCP) through virtual server.  Value 'enable' means virtual server will accept and participate in MPTCP connections.  Value 'passthrough' means MPTCP packets may pass through virtual server

mptcpCsum.title: MPTCP checksums
mptcpCsum.description: If true, the system calculates MPTCP checksums (default false)

mptcpCsumVerify.title: MPTCP checksum verify
mptcpCsumVerify.description: If true, the system verifies MPTCP checksums (default false)

mptcpFallback.title: MPTCP fallback action
mptcpFallback.description: Selects action on fallback from MPTCP to ordinary TCP

mptcpFastJoin.title: MPTCP fast join
mptcpFastJoin.description: If true, the system may send data with MP_JOIN SYN packet, reducing connection latency (default false)

mptcpIdleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
mptcpIdleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion

mptcpJoinMax.title: MPTCP join maximum
mptcpJoinMax.description: Limit on number of subflows which the system may add to the MPTCP connection (default 5)

mptcpMakeAfterBreak.title: MPTCP make-after-break
mptcpMakeAfterBreak.description: If true, the system can add additional subflows during the 'mptcpTimeout' period, even if the ADC is not currently handling an active connection (default false)

mptcpNoJoinDssAck.title: MPTCP fast join
mptcpNoJoinDssAck.description: If true, no DSS option will sent with MP_JOIN ACK packet (default false)

mptcpRtoMax.title: MPTCP RTO maximum
mptcpRtoMax.description: Maximum number of retransmission timeouts which may occur before the system declares a subflow dead

mptcpRetransmitMin.title: MPTCP retransmit timer
mptcpRetransmitMin.description: Minimum value in milliseconds (default 1000) of MPTCP retransmission timer

mptcpSubflowMax.title: MPTCP subflow maximum
mptcpSubflowMax.description: Maximum number of subflows per connection (default 6)

mptcpTimeout.title: MPTCP timeout
mptcpTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 3600) after which the system may expunge an MPTCP session with no active flow

nagle.title: Nagle's algorithm
nagle.description: Value 'enable' means to use Nagle's algorithm to minimize the transmission of short TCP segments (note:  Nagle's algorithm yields undesirable results with many application protocols).  Value 'auto' (default) means the ADC will choose automatically whether to enable Nagle's algorithm.  Value 'disable' averts application of Nagle's algorithm

pktLossIgnoreBurst.title: Packet loss ignore burst
pktLossIgnoreBurst.description: Modulates use of congestion control when losing multiple packets.  Value 0 (default) means to perform congestion control if any packet loss occurs.  Higher values increase tolerance for lost packets before signaling congestion

pktLossIgnoreRate.title: Packet loss ignore rate
pktLossIgnoreRate.description: Sets threshold of packet loss rate (lost-packets/million-packets) above which the system performs congestion control.  Value 0 (default) means to perform congestion control if any packet loss occurs.  Higher values increase tolerance for lost packets before signaling congestion

proxyBufferHigh.title: Proxy-buffer high
proxyBufferHigh.description: The system closes the receive window when the number of octets in proxy buffer rises above this value

proxyBufferLow.title: Proxy-buffer low
proxyBufferLow.description: The system opens the receive window when the number of octets in proxy buffer falls below this value

proxyMSS.title: Proxy MSS
proxyMSS.description: If true (default), the MSS value advertised on the server side will match that negotiated with the client, if permitted by MTU and other constraints

proxyOptions.title: Proxy options
proxyOptions.description: If true, TCP options such as timestamp advertised on the server side will match those negotiated with client (default false)

pushFlag.title: PuSH flag control
pushFlag.description: Controls when ADC sets PSH flag in outbound TCP segments.  Limiting the sending of segments with PSH improves performance.  Value 'auto' (recommended) sets PSH according to a system algorithm optimal in most cases.  Value 'default' (not recommended) sets the PUSH flag in every segment which happens to empty the send buffer.  Value 'none' prevents use of the PSH flag, and 'one' means the system sets PSH only when FIN is, at the end of a connection

ratePace.title: Rate pace
ratePace.description: If true (default), system will automatically pace rate of data transmission to optimize throughput

ratePaceMaxRate.title: Rate pace maximum rate
ratePaceMaxRate.description: Limit maximum data-transmission rate in octets/second to this value when 'ratePace' is true.  Default 0 means choose maximum rate automatically

receiveWindowSize.title: Receive-window size
receiveWindowSize.description: Maximum size of receive window (octets, default 131072)

resetOnTimeout.title: Reset on timeout
resetOnTimeout.description: If true (default), connections which time out will be reset (that is, the system will send an RST packet to the peer) before the system expunges them.  Value false is not recommended

retransmitThreshold.title: Retransmit threshold
retransmitThreshold.description: Specifies the number of duplicate ACKs to start fast recovery

selectiveAcks.title: Selective ACKs
selectiveAcks.description: If true (default), the system negotiates rfc2018 Selective Acknowledgements with peers

selectiveNack.title: Selective NAK
selectiveNack.description: If true, the system negotiates Selective Negative Acknowledgements with peers (default false)

sendBufferSize.title: Send-buffer size
sendBufferSize.description: Maximum size of send buffer (octets, default 262144)

slowStart.title: Slow-start
slowStart.description: If true (default), AS3 adjusts the initial window size per rfc3390.  This generally makes connections start more quickly, NOT more slowly

synCookieEnable.title: SYN cookie enable
synCookieEnable.description: If true (default), the system may use SYN cookies to avert connection-table overflow (for example, from DoS attacks)

synCookieWhitelist.title: SYN cookie whitelist
synCookieWhitelist.description: If true, after a client responds successfully to a SYN cookie challenge, the system accepts additional connection requests from that client without challenge for 30 seconds (default false)

synMaxRetrans.title: Maximum SYN retransmissions
synMaxRetrans.description: Maximum number of times the system retransmits a SYN when it does not receive a SYN+ACK (default 3)

synRtoBase.title: SYN RTO base
synRtoBase.description: Number of milliseconds (default 3000) to which the system initially sets the SYN retransmission timer.  The system adjusts the timer after each retransmission to implement binary-exponential-backoff

tailLossProbe.title: Tail loss probe
tailLossProbe.description: If true (default), the system uses the Tail Loss Probe scheme to reduce retransmission timeouts

tcpOptions.title: TCP options capture for iRules
tcpOptions.description: Selects which TCP Option values the system captures for reference by iRules

option.title: Number
option.description: Specifies the TCP option to capture

when.title: When seen
when.description: Specifies when to capture the TCP option

timestamps.title: Timestamps
timestamps.description: If true (default and recommended), AS3 enables rfc1323 timestamps

timeWaitRecycle.title: TIME-WAIT recycle
timeWaitRecycle.description: If true (default), the system reuses connection resources immediately when it receives a SYN during the TIME-WAIT period

timeWaitTimeout.title: Time-wait timeout
timeWaitTimeout.description: Number of milliseconds (default 2,000) connection will remain in TIME-WAIT state before closing.  Value -1 means indefinite

ttlMode.title: TTL mode
ttlMode.description: Controls IP TTL in outgoing packets.  Value 'set' forces TTL to value of property 'ttlIPv4' or 'ttlIPv6' as appropriate.  Value 'proxy' (default) forces TTL to the default value for IPv4 or IPv6 as appropriate.  Value 'preserve' copies TTL from received packet.  Value 'decrement' sets TTL to one less than received packet's TTL

ttlIPv4.title: TTL for IPv4
ttlIPv4.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv4 packets

ttlIPv6.title: TTL for IPv6
ttlIPv6.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv6 packets

verifiedAccept.title: Verified accept
verifiedAccept.description: If true, the system must establish a server-side connection before a it accepts a corresponding client-side connection (default false).  Value 'true' is incompatible with iRules

zeroWindowTimeout.title: Zero-window timeout
zeroWindowTimeout.description: Number of milliseconds (default 20,000) connection will persist with window-size of zero (effective timeout is value rounded up to the nearest multiple of 5000).  Value -1 means indefinite

UDP_Profile.title: UDP Profile
UDP_Profile.description: Configures a User Datagram Protocol (UDP) profile

allowNoPayload.title: Allow empty payload
allowNoPayload.description: When true, forward UDP datagrams with empty payloads (default false)

bufferMaxBytes.title: Buffer maximum-bytes
bufferMaxBytes.description: Limit to number of octets which the system may buffer for a UDP flow (default 655350)

bufferMaxPackets.title: Buffer maximum-packets
bufferMaxPackets.description: Limit to number of packets which the system may buffer for a UDP flow (default 0)

datagramLoadBalancing.title: Datagram load-balancing
datagramLoadBalancing.description: When true, process UDP datagrams independently, without recognizing flows (default false)

idleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 60) flow may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion.  Value 0 allows system to recover per-flow resources whenever convenient (always safe with UDP). Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

ipDfMode.title: IP DF mode
ipDfMode.description: Controls DF (Don't Fragment) flag in outgoing datagrams.  Value 'pmtu' (default) sets DF based on IP PMTU value.  Value 'preserve' copies DF from received datagram.  Value 'set' forces DF true in all outgoing datagrams.  Value 'clear' forces DF false in all outgoing datagrams

ipTosToClient.title: IP TOS/DSCP to client
ipTosToClient.description: Specifies the IP TOS/DSCP value in packets sent to clients (default 0).  Numeric values in this property are decimal representations of eight-bit numbers, of which the leftmost six bits are the DSCP code per rfc2474 (and the rightmost two bits reserved).  You may have to calculate the value of this property by multiplying a DSCP code, such as CS5+EF = 46, by four, to obtain the 'ipTosToClient' value, such as 184.  Value 'pass-through' sets DSCP from the initial server-side value.  Value 'mimic' copies DSCP from the most-recently received server-side packet (allowing DSCP to vary during the life of a connection)

linkQosToClient.title: Link QOS to client
linkQosToClient.description: Specifies the Layer-2 QOS value in packets sent to clients (default 0).  Ethernet-type networks recognize numeric codes from 0 to 7.  Value 'pass-through' sets QOS from the initial server-side value

proxyMSS.title: Proxy MSS
proxyMSS.description: When true, MSS advertised on the server side will match that negotiated with the client, if permitted by MTU and other constraints (default false)

ttlMode.title: TTL mode
ttlMode.description: Controls IP TTL in outgoing datagrams.  Value 'set' forces TTL to value of property 'ttlIPv4' or 'ttlIPv6' as appropriate.  Value 'proxy' forces TTL to the default value for IPv4 or IPv6 as appropriate.  Value 'preserve' copies TTL from received datagram.  Value 'decrement' sets TTL to one less than received datagrams's TTL

ttlIPv4.title: TTL for IPv4
ttlIPv4.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv4 datagrams

ttlIPv6.title: TTL for IPv6
ttlIPv6.description: TTL the system sets in outgoing IPv6 datagrams

useChecksum.title: Use checksum
useChecksum.description: When true, system will validate UDP checksums for IPv4 datagrams (default false).  Checksums are always validated for IPv6

clientTimeout.title: Client timeout
clientTimeout.description: Number of seconds allowed for a client to transmit enough data to select a server when you have late binding enabled. Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

idleTimeout.title: Idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Number of seconds (default 300; may not be 0) connection may remain idle before it becomes eligible for deletion.  Value -1 (not recommended) means infinite

keepAliveInterval.title: Keep-alive interval
keepAliveInterval.description: Number of seconds between keep-alive probes. A value of 0 seconds disables the feature.

looseClose.title: Loose close
looseClose.description: When true, system closes a loosely-initiated connection when the system receives the first FIN packet from either the client or the server (default false).

looseInitialization.title: Loose initialization
looseInitialization.description: When true, system initializes a connection when it receives any TCP packet, rather than requiring a SYN packet for connection initiation (default false).

maxSegmentSize.title: MSS
maxSegmentSize.description: Sets MSS advertised to peer.  Value 0 (default) will set MSS automatically in proportion to interface MTU.  Default 0 is usually the best choice

resetOnTimeout.title: Reset on timeout
resetOnTimeout.description: If true (default), connections which time out will be reset (that is, the system sends an RST packet to the peer) before the system expunges them

tcpCloseTimeout.title: TCP Close timeout
tcpCloseTimeout.description: Specifies an TCP close timeout in seconds.  Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

tcpHandshakeTimeout.title: TCP Handshake timeout
tcpHandshakeTimeout.description: Specifies a TCP handshake timeout in seconds. The default value is 5 seconds.  Value -1 means indefinite (not recommended)

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the object to inherit the settings from

Radius_Profile.description: Configures a RADIUS profile for network traffic load balancing

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the object to inherit the settings from

persistAttribute.description: Specifies the name of the RADIUS attribute on which traffic persists. Acceptable values are ASCII strings from section 5 of RFC 2865 or numeric codes (1-255). A value of none indicates that persistence is disabled.

protocolProfile.description: Specifies PEM protocol profile that defines mapping of RADIUS AVPs to subscriber ID and other PEM subscriber session attributes

subscriberDiscoveryEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable PEM subscriber discovery based on the content of RADIUS packets

IP_Other_Profile.description: Configures a generic IP profile for non-TCP and non-UDP traffic

parentProfile.description: Specifies the name of the object to inherit the settings from

idleTimeout.description: Specifies the number of seconds a connection can be idle before the connection is eligible for deletion
idleTimeout.$comment: It might be possible to specify a value of 0 and remove the immediate option

Constants.title: Constants
Constants.description: Named values for (re-)use by declaration objects

allowReuse.title: Allow reuse
allowReuse.description: If true (default), cryptogram may be reused by different declaration objects, WHICH MAY POSE A SECURITY RISK!

Label.title: Label
Label.description: Optional friendly name for this object

Remark.title: Remark
Remark.description: Arbitrary (brief) text pertaining to this object (optional)

F5string.title: String value
F5string.description: String value optionally in base64 or from URL or AS3 pointer

copyFrom.title: Copy from
copyFrom.description: AS3 pointer to declaration object/property from which to copy value

bigip.title: BIG-IP component pathname
bigip.description: Pathname of existing BIG-IP component

Secret.title: Secret value
Secret.description: A value: (a) in a cryptogram in this object; (b) in a cryptogram elsewhere in this declaration; or (c) available from a URL

allowReuse.title: Allow reuse
allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

reuseFrom.title: Reuse from
reuseFrom.description: AS3 pointer to another JWE cryptogram in this declaration to copy

url.title: URL
url.description: URL from which secret should be fetched

JWE.title: JWE cryptogram
JWE.description: A value in a cryptogram which is a Flattened JWE JSON Serialization object.  If 'miniJWE' is true then enc=(none|f5sv) only (in JOSE header)

miniJWE.title: Mini JWE
miniJWE.description: If true (default), object is an f5 mini-JWE

protected.title: JOSE header
protected.description: JOSE header: alg=dir, enc=(none|f5sv); default enc=none (encoded default is 'protected'='eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJub25lIn0', use with secret simply base64url-encoded into 'ciphertext').  If you see 'protected'='eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJmNXN2In0', 'ciphertext' contains base64url-encoded SecureVault cryptogram

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the ciphertext in every AS3 declaration deployment. If true, AS3 creates the ciphertext on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

logLevel.title: Log level
logLevel.description: Controls the amount of detail in logs produced while configuring this Tenant (default is whole-declaration Controls/logLevel value)

trace.title: Trace
trace.description: If true, AS3 creates a detailed trace of the configuration process for this Tenant for subsequent analysis (default is whole-declaration Controls/trace value).  Warning:  trace files may contain sensitive configuration data

traceResponse.title: Trace Response
traceResponse.description: If true, the response will contain the trace files

fortune.title: Fortune
fortune.description: If true, AS3 will activate Zoltar mode and read you your fortune

Metadata.title: Metadata
Metadata.description: Useful datapoints for tracking, tagging, and organizing declarations.
Metadata.$comment: Properties are arbitrarily set by the user.

bypassList.description: List of URIs that are bypassed in a web page when a rewrite mode of portal is used

responseSettings.description: The response settings used for uri-translation

setCookieRules.description: The rules for rewriting HTTP Set-Cookie headers. Used with a rewrite mode of uri-translation

splitTunnelingEnabled.description: Determines if the profile provides for split tunneling

uriRules.description: The rules for rewriting request and response headers and response bodies. Used with a rewrite mode of uri-translation

The path of the server. Must be an absolute directory path

rewriteHeadersEnabled.description: Determines if request headers are rewritten

rewriteContentEnabled.description: Determines if response content should be rewritten

rewriteHeadersEnabled.description: Determines if response headers should be rewritten

parentProfile.description: The profile that this profile inherits values from

agingRate.description: Rate at which a cache entry ages

ignoreHeaders.description: Which cache disabling headers will be ignored by the system

insertAgeHeaderEnabled.description: Age and date headers are inserted into the response when enabled

maximumAge.description: How long the system will consider the cached content will be valid

maximumEntries.description: The maximum number of entries that can reside in the cache

maximumObjectSize.description: The largest object that the system will cache

minimumObjectSize.description: The smallest object that the system will cache

cacheSize.description: The maximum size (in megabytes) for the cache

uriExcludeList.description: A list of URIs that will be excluded from the cache

uriIncludeList.description: A list of URIs that will be cacheable

uriIncludeOverrideList.description: A list of URIs that should be cached even though they may normally not be due to existing constraints

uriPinnedList.description: A list of URIs that are kept in the cache regardless of maxAge or expiry settings

metadataMaxSize.description: The maximum size of the metadata cache

parentProfile.description: Specifies the profile that this profile will inherit values from

chunkingEnabled.description: Specifies that incoming data should be parsed in chunks

chunkSize.description: The maximum size that a parsed chunk can be

target.description: Specifies the new string that will replace the source string

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the profile in every AS3 declaration deployment. If true, AS3 creates the profile on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards. However, if enable is set to true, the policy will be applied even if ignoreChanges is true

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Apply the profile after updating it. If false (default), the system only updates the profile. Also note 'ignoreChanges'.

Per_Request_Access_Policy.description: Configures a Per Flow Request Access Policy

url.title: URL
url.description: The URL to pull the policy from

ignoreChanges.title: Ignore changes
ignoreChanges.description: If false (default), the system updates the profile in every AS3 declaration deployment. If true, AS3 creates the profile on first deployment, and leaves it untouched afterwards

uri.description: Specifies the absolute URI that contains both the complete hostname and the path of the resource to use in the ICAP header. Macro expansion is supported for all attribute values in the ICAP header (e.g. icap://${SERVER_IP}:${SERVER_PORT}/videoOptimization)

fromHeader.description: Specifies the 'From' attribute to use in the ICAP header

hostHeader.description: Specifies the 'Host' attribute to use in the ICAP header

refererHeader.description: Specifies the 'Referer' attribute to use in the ICAP header

userAgentHeader.description: Specifies the 'User-Agent' attribute to use in the ICAP header

previewLength.description: Specifies the length of the preview in the transaction

Adapt_Profile.description: Configures a request or response Adapt profile or both

messageType.description: The type of Adapt profile. Use both to create a request and response profile with the same property values

enableHttpAdaptation.description: Enable or disable the adaptation of HTTP requests/responses. They will be forwarded to the internal service

internalService.description: Specifies the name of the internal service to use for adapting the request/response

previewSize.description: Specifies the maximum size of the preview buffer

serviceDownAction.description: Specifies the action to take if the internal service doesn't exist or is down

timeout.description: Specifies how long in miliseconds to wait for the internal service before a timeout error will occur

allowHTTP10.description: Specifies whether to forward HTTP 1.0 requests/responses

signatureAlgorithms.description: Specifies the digital signature algorithms used for authentication. signatureAlgorithms are only supported on BIG-IP 14.0 and later.

excludeCipherRules.description: Exclude the following Cipher_Rules from the Allowed list.

requireCipherRules.description: Restrict the Allowed list to the following Cipher_Rules.

Firewall_Address_List.title: Firewall Address List
Firewall_Address_List.description: Declares an address-list for use by firewall rules. An address list is a list of IP-address prefixes to compare against the source-IP address and/or destination-IP address in an IP packet

addresses.description: A list of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and address ranges. You can specify a network with CIDR slash notation.

addressDiscovery.title: Address discovery
addressDiscovery.description: Selects how server (node) addresses are discovered

fqdns.description: A list of fully qualified domain names.

geo.description: A list of geographic locations (for example, US:Washington).

addressLists.description: A list of other address lists (each by AS3 pointer or BIG-IP pathname).

Firewall_Port_List.title: Firewall Port List
Firewall_Port_List.description: Declares a port-list for use by firewall rules. A firewall rule can match a packet's source port or destination port against one of the ports in a port list, and can take some action (such as ACCEPT or DROP) for a matching packet.

ports.description: A list of ports and port ranges (for example, 80, "8080-8090").

Firewall_Rule_List.title: Firewall Rule List
Firewall_Rule_List.description: Declares a list of network firewall rules. You can reuse a rule list in multiple firewalls, such as the firewalls for self IPs, routing domains, and the global firewall.

Firewall_Rule_Source.description: Declares the packet sources to which the network firewall rule applies.

NAT_Source_Translation.description: Configures a Security network address translation source translation object

addresses.description: Specifies addresses on which source translation is performed

allowEgressInterfaces.description: Specifies the egress interfaces (tunnels and VLANs) on which source translation is allowed

clientConnectionLimit.description: Maximum number of simultaneous translated connections a client or subscriber is allowed to have

disallowEgressInterfaces.description: Specifies the egress interfaces (tunnels and VLANs) on which source translation is not allowed

hairpinModeEnabled.description: Enables or disables hairpinning for incoming connections to active translation end-points

inboundMode.description: Specifies the persistence settings for NAT translation entries

patMode.description: Specifies whether the translation address mapping is performed in Network Address Port Translation mode, Deterministic mode, or in Port Block Allocation mode

ports.description: Specifies source ports and port ranges on which source translation is performed

routeAdvertisement.description: Specifies that the traffic is advertised to dynamic routing protocols configured in the route domain

type.description: Specifies the type of source translation item

excludeAddresses.description: Specifies the set of addresses excluded from translation IP addresses available in the pool

NAT_Source_Translation_Mapping.description: Configure the mapping settings for translation entries. It is the preservation of a public-side IP address for a client from session to session. Only available if type is dynamic-pat.

mode.description: Specifies the mapping mode for translation entries

timeout.description: Specifies the timeout (in seconds) for address and port mapping

blockIdleTimeout.description: Specifies the amount of time in seconds that an assigned block of ports remains available when idle before it times out

blockLifetime.description: Specifies the lifetime in seconds of a block of ports

blockSize.description: Specifies the number of ports per block.  Each block is assigned to one client.  A client can use all ports in a block multiplied by the number of blocks, up to the connection limit, if one is set

clientBlockLimit.description: Specifies the number of blocks that can be assigned to a client

zombieTimeout.description: Specifies the timeout duration for a zombie port block, which is a timed out port block with one or more active connections

Data_Group.description: Configures a data group object which contains list of data

Data_Group_Records_Base.description: Configures data group records to store
